title: Escalation Risks in LLM-Powered Wargaming: A First Assessment
authors: Reddie, Andrew; Goldblum, Bethany; Laderman, Sarah; Trinkunas, Harold
abstract: This paper presents findings from a wargaming exercise exploring nuclear escalation risks when large language models participate in crisis simulations. We find that LLMs tend to escalate conflicts more readily than human players.
notes_ta: Highly relevant - direct study of LLM wargaming

title: GPT-4 as Strategic Decision Maker in Military Simulations
abstract: We evaluate GPT-4's performance as a strategic decision maker in complex military simulations, comparing its choices against expert human players and identifying systematic biases.
notes_ta: Core paper on GPT-4 in military context

title: Adversarial Red Teaming with Language Models
abstract: This study examines the use of large language models as red team adversaries in cybersecurity wargaming exercises, demonstrating both novel attack strategies and inherent limitations.

title: Human-AI Collaboration in Crisis Management Games
authors: Williams, Sarah; Brown, Robert; Davis, Emily
abstract: We present a framework for human-AI collaboration in crisis management wargames, where LLMs serve as advisors to human decision makers, improving outcomes while maintaining human control.

title: Hallucination and Deception in AI Wargame Agents
abstract: Analysis of hallucination patterns and deceptive behaviors exhibited by LLM agents in competitive wargaming scenarios, with implications for trust and verification.

title: Quantitative Scoring Methods for LLM Wargame Performance
abstract: Development and validation of quantitative metrics for evaluating LLM performance in wargaming contexts, including decision quality, strategic coherence, and outcome optimization.

title: Open-Ended Naval Strategy Games with Transformer Models
abstract: Implementation of open-ended naval strategy wargames using transformer-based language models, allowing for emergent tactics and natural language command interfaces.

title: Bias Mitigation in LLM-Powered Political-Military Games
venue: ACM Conference on AI and Society
abstract: Techniques for identifying and mitigating cultural and political biases in LLM behavior during political-military wargaming exercises.
